Identification.LongTitle: An Act respecting the Split Lake Cree First Nation and the settlement of matters arising from an agreement relating to the flooding of land
Identification.ShortTitle: Split Lake Cree First Nation Flooded Land Act
Identification.RunningHead: Split Lake Cree First Nation Flooded Land

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Split Lake Cree First Nation Flooded Land Act.

Definition.Text: agreement means the agreement concluded between

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Her Majesty in right of Canada,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Her Majesty in right of Manitoba,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Split Lake Cree First Nation,

ContinuedDefinition.Text: pursuant to negotiations relating to the comprehensive implementation of the Flood Agreement and signed on June 24, 1992; (accord)

Definition.Text: Flood Agreement means the agreement concerning the flooding of land concluded between

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Her Majesty in right of Canada,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Her Majesty in right of Manitoba,

Subsection.Text: Amounts paid to the Split Lake Cree First Nation pursuant to the agreement, whether before or after the coming into force of this Act, are not Indian moneys within the meaning of subsection 2(1) of the Indian Act.

As soon as practicable after the coming into force of this Act, all amounts collected, received or held by Her Majesty in right of Canada for the use or benefit of the Split Lake Cree First Nation pursuant to the agreement shall be transferred to the Split Lake Cree First Nation in accordance with the agreement.

Section.Text: Subsection 35(4) of the Indian Act does not apply in respect of any amount paid, whether before or after the coming into force of this Act, to the Split Lake Cree First Nation pursuant to the agreement.

Where land is held or transferred pursuant to the agreement, section 36 of the Indian Act does not apply in respect of that land if the holder or transferee of the land, or any subsequent holder or transferee of the land, is not Her Majesty in right of Canada.
A claim provided for by both the Flood Agreement and the agreement may be exercised by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the Split Lake Cree First Nation,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the council of the Split Lake Cree First Nation, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a body corporate or an unincorporated association to which the Flood Agreement applies

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that was incorporated or established by the council of the Split Lake Cree First Nation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the shareholders or members of which are all or substantially all members of the Split Lake Cree First Nation,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: only in accordance with the agreement.

Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided in the agreement, the legislation of Manitoba relating to arbitration applies in respect of any dispute between the parties to the agreement that, under the terms of the agreement, is to be settled by way of arbitration.
